results.abstract: Richard Garriott of Austin, Tex, computer game creator, is avid collector of Soviet space memorabilia; collection includes authentic spare Sputnik satellite; he is son of retired astronaut, Owen K Garriott, and has bought $30 million seat on Soyuz flight to International Space Station scheduled for Oct 2008; photo (M)

headline.main: Texas Man Linked to Past and Future of Space Exploration by Sputnik and Soyuz

results.snippet: A collector of space memorabilia plans to follow his father’s footsteps into space.
results.lead_paragraph: AUSTIN, Tex. -- Richard Garriott hefts his Sputnik overhead like a shiny aluminum beach ball, playing with history. ''It's a beautiful thing,'' Mr. Garriott says of the hollow sphere with its four famous whisker antennas, which he has left partly disassembled so the shortened shafts can serve as legs.

headline.main: Space Station Awaits Crew With 2 Firsts

results.snippet: A new crew bound for the International Space Station, including Malaysia’s first astronaut and the first woman assigned to command the station, blasted off Wednesday aboard a Russian Soyuz spacecraft.
results.lead_paragraph: A new crew bound for the International Space Station, including Malaysia's first astronaut and the first woman assigned to command the station, blasted off Wednesday aboard a Russian Soyuz spacecraft. The spacecraft, which lifted off at 9:22 a.m. Eastern time from the Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan, slipped into orbit nine minutes later. The ship is expected to dock with the space station on Friday morning.

results.abstract: Russian Soyuz craft bearing first woman to command International Space Station, Peggy A Whitson, docks with station; capsule ferried Whitson, Col Yuri I Malenchenko and Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor, Malaysia's first astronaut; this is Whitson's second six-month stay on station; her photo (S)

headline.main: NATIONAL BRIEFING | SCIENCE & HEALTH | Russian Craft Docks With Space Station

results.snippet: The Russian Soyuz craft bearing the first woman to command the International Space Station, Peggy A. Whitson, left, docked with the station. The capsule ferried Dr. Whitson; Col. Yuri I. Malenchenko, a Russian flight engineer; and Sheikh Muszaphar...
results.lead_paragraph: The Russian Soyuz craft bearing the first woman to command the International Space Station, Peggy A. Whitson, left, docked with the station. The capsule ferried Dr. Whitson; Col. Yuri I. Malenchenko, a Russian flight engineer; and Sheikh Muszaphar Shukor, Malaysia's first astronaut. This is Ms. Whitson's second six-month stay on the station; she served as a science officer aboard the orbiting laboratory in 2002. The change of command will occur Oct. 19, and she will greet the crew of the shuttle Discovery, which is expected to launch Oct. 23. The Discovery will also be commanded by a woman, Col. Pamela A. Melroy, retired from the Air Force, and will carry a new module to the station.

results.lead_paragraph: The latest from "Weekend Update" on NBC's "Saturday Night Live":

results.abstract: Excerpts from interview with Cindy Lee Van Dover, first woman to direct Duke University Marine Laboratory in Beaufort, NC; photo (M)

headline.kicker: A CONVERSATION WITH  CINDY LEE VAN DOVER
headline.main: Deep in the Sea, Imagining the Cradle of Life on Earth

results.snippet: Cindy Lee Van Dover is a pioneer: a submarine pilot and the first woman to direct the Duke University Marine Laboratory.
results.lead_paragraph: For much of Cindy Lee Van Dover's professional life, she has been a pioneer. In 1990, she became the first woman with a license to pilot an Alvin, a three-person submarine for deep sea exploration. Dr. Van Dover, who studies the ecology of the ocean floor, has since led almost 50 expeditions on the Alvin, documenting the terrain and creatures of that mysterious environment. In almost every one of these explorations, she has discovered new life forms and animals.

results.abstract: A new version of Linux offers 3D graphics to attract desktop computer users and eventually buyers of consumer electronics devices.

headline.main: Ubuntu Plans Eye Candy for Desktop Computers and Beyond

results.snippet: A new version of Linux offers 3D graphics to attract desktop computer users and eventually buyers of consumer electronics devices.
results.lead_paragraph: What would it take to get the hundreds of millions of desktop computer users to switch from Windows to Linux?

results.abstract: Space shuttle Discovery is set to launch Oct 23 on ambitious mission to International Space Station that will involve moving and extending array of solar panels; engineers at NASA Engineering and Safety Center have expressed concerns about wear on shuttle's heat-resistant panels; they say mission should be delayed; NASA officials have deemed mission within bounds of acceptable risk; photos (M)
results.snippet: NASA is planning to begin a mission to the International Space Station on Tuesday, but a last-minute dispute is raising fundamental questions about the risks.
results.lead_paragraph: NASA is planning to launch the shuttle Discovery on Tuesday, beginning a mission to the International Space Station so crowded with construction tasks that one of the astronauts, the four-time space veteran Scott E. Parazynski, has called the challenge ''off-scale high.'' But a conflict has emerged in recent weeks about whether this mission should be launching at all, and a last-minute dispute -- in which NASA officials overruled safety engineers -- is raising fundamental questions about the risks of the aging shuttle.

results.abstract: Profile of and interview with Lance Bass, former N'Sync member who has joined cast of Hairspray and is author of new memoir Out of Sync; photos (M)
results.snippet: A memoir of life and times in a major boy-band.
results.lead_paragraph: Lance Bass has faced his share of screaming girls -- the teenyboppers, mother-daughter pairs and grown women who have followed him since he joined the pop band 'NSync at 16. But the fan-boys are sort of new. ''He's really cute,'' said Richie Tran, 35, a Manhattan doctor, recently as he waited for Mr. Bass to appear at the stage door of ''Hairspray,'' the Broadway show Mr. Bass joined in August.

results.snippet: For PCs, Ubuntu Plans Eye Candy      What would it take to get the hundreds of millions of desktop computer users to switch from Windows to the open-source operating system Linux?
results.lead_paragraph: For PCs, Ubuntu Plans Eye Candy What would it take to get the hundreds of millions of desktop computer users to switch from Windows to the open-source operating system Linux?

results.snippet: The crew of the space shuttle mission scheduled to begin on Oct. 23 is close-knit team known for its camaraderie and inside jokes.
results.lead_paragraph: The crew of the space shuttle mission scheduled to begin on Oct. 23 is close-knit team known for its camaraderie and inside jokes. Many within the space community call this the ''Bo'' flight, because the astronaut's nicknames follow a ''Rambo'' pattern. The shuttle commander, Pam Melroy, is a retired Air Force colonel who picked up the nickname ''Pambo.'' The pilot, Col. George Zamka of the Marine Corps, had picked up the call sign ''Zambo.'' ''It just so happened we got assigned to the same crew,'' Col. Zamka said in an interview, ''and we decided we could either embrace it or run away from it. And I wanted to run away from it, but the rest of the crew wouldn't do it. So we're all some kind of 'bo' name.''

results.abstract: Shuttle Discovery takes off from Cape Canaveral, Fla, carrying new Harmony module that will add living space to International Space Station; photo (M)

headline.main: Shuttle Starts a Mission to Carry New Module for the Space Station

results.snippet: Despite weather concerns and a small chunk of ice that threatened to delay the beginning of the shuttle Discovery’s mission, everything seemed to fall into place.
results.lead_paragraph: The shuttle Discovery thundered off the pad on Tuesday morning, heading toward the International Space Station with a new Harmony module that will add living space to the orbiting laboratory. Despite weather concerns and a small chunk of ice that threatened to delay the beginning of the 14-day mission, everything seemed to fall into place in the final minutes.

results.abstract: China launches its first lunar probe as Communist Party moves step closer to fulfilling its ambitions of one day reaching moon; satellite is expected to orbit moon for next year, providing images and other information as China prepares to launch space vehicle to moon by 2012 and then send astronaut by 2020 (M)

headline.main: China Sends Its First Probe For the Moon Into Space

results.snippet: China launched its first lunar probe on Wednesday as the Communist Party moved a step closer to fulfilling its ambitions of one day reaching the moon.
results.lead_paragraph: With a regional space race heating up in Asia, China launched its first lunar probe on Wednesday as the Communist Party moved a step closer to fulfilling its ambitions of one day reaching the moon. The Chang'e-1 satellite, named after a Chinese goddess who flew to the moon, lifted off at 6:05 p.m. Officials and tourists watched the launching at a site in Sichuan Province, while state television provided coverage to the rest of the nation.

results.abstract: Space shuttle Discovery docks with International Space Station with Pamela A Melroy shuttle commander and Peggy A Whitson commander of space station; it is first time that women have been at helm of both crafts during space docking (M)

headline.main: Space Docking, With Women At the Helm of Both Crafts

results.snippet: A hug on Thursday between the commanders of the space shuttle Discovery and the International Space Station marked the first time that women have served in both roles at the same time.
results.lead_paragraph: A hug on Thursday between the commanders of the space shuttle Discovery and the International Space Station marked the first time that women have served in both roles at the same time. Led by the shuttle commander, Pamela A. Melroy, and the station commander, Peggy A. Whitson, the crews met with shouts of greeting and hearty embraces as the two vehicles made their way around the earth at 17,000 miles per hour, crossing over North Carolina.

results.abstract: Discovery astronauts add new room to International Space Station; astronauts, working outside station and within it, use station's robot arm to move 16-ton Harmony module out of shuttle and onto station; diagram; photo (M)

headline.main: In Construction Mode, Astronauts Add to Station

results.snippet: The 16-ton new module will serve as a connection point for two new laboratories for the station.
results.lead_paragraph: Astronauts added the newest room to the International Space Station Friday morning. Working both outside the station and within it, the astronauts moved the Harmony module, which will serve as a connection point for two new laboratories, to a temporary location.

results.abstract: NASA will add day to mission of space shuttle Discovery so crew members can do repairs on malfunctioning rotary joint that turns solar panels to provide power to International Space Station; diagram of rotary joint (M)

headline.main: NASA Extends Shuttle Mission to Work on Station

results.snippet: NASA will tack a day on to the mission of the space shuttle Discovery so crew members can do “exploratory surgery” on part of the International Space Station.
results.lead_paragraph: NASA mission managers will add a day to the mission of the space shuttle Discovery so crew members can do ''exploratory surgery'' on a malfunctioning part of the International Space Station's power system, the space agency announced yesterday. The problem concerns a rotary joint on the right side of the station that turns the station's solar arrays so they face the sun during orbit. During an initial examination on Sunday, the spacewalking astronaut Daniel M. Tani collected what he called ''metal-to-metal scraping'' that peppered the inside of the joint mechanism. Mr. Tani picked up some of the fragments with tape and took them back into the space station.

results.abstract: In this lesson, students research, write and present a pitch for a television show about life at the International Space Station.
results.snippet: In this lesson, students research, write and present a pitch for a television show about life at the International Space Station.
